title: 1997 Horror Classic I Know What You Did Last Summer Returns With A 4K Blu-Ray Release
description: I Know What You Did Last Summer 4K Steelbook Edition $56 | Releases June 24 Preorder at Amazon The 1997 slasher film I Know What You Did Last Summer is getting a new reboot later this year, but if you're looking to catch up on the slasher franchise before then, then you can preorder a new 4K Steelbook Edition of the first film. Priced at $56 and scheduled to arrive on June 24, this re-release of the film includes a spooky steelbook cover, a standard Blu-ray copy of the film, and a digital streaming code. I Know What You Did Last Summer 4K Steelbook Edition $56 | Releases June 24 Like the previous 4K release of I Know What You Did Last Summer, this version comes with a nice selection of bonus materials. On the disc, you'll find deleted scenes, an alternate ending, commentary tracks, and more. This is also looks to be one of the best versions of the cult-classic thriller, as it was scanned from the original camera negatives and remastered in 4K and in Dolby Vision. It comes in an exclusive steelbook case featuring artwork from the film. Preorder at Amazon I Know What You Did Last Summer 4K Blu-rayI Know What You Did Last Summer 4K Steelbook Edition Bonus FeaturesHere's a look at all of the special features included in the I Know What You Did Last Summer 4K Steelbook Edition:Six deleted scenesAlternate endingMy Own Summer: An interview with director Jim GillespieHe Knows What You Did: An interview with Muse WatsonFilmmakers' commentaryDirector's short film: Joyride, with optional commentaryNow I Know What You Did Last Summer featuretteMusic video: "Hush" performed by Kula ShakerTheatrical trailerI Know What You Did Last Summer was a big hit when it came out in 1997, back when it was released during the '90s Renaissance of teen-slasher movies. Adapted from the 1973 novel of the same name written by Lois Duncan-Arquette, the film follows four teens after they accidentally run over a person, dump his body in the sea, and then face the wrath of a homicidal fisherman who knows their dark secret. The movie starred Jennifer Love Hewitt, Freddie Prinze Jr., Sarah Michel Gellar, and Ryan Phillipe, and at the box office, it was a huge hit.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get Up To 25 Steam Games For $16 With Fanatical's New Mystery Egg Bundle
description: Fanatical has launched a new edition of its Mystery Egg Bundle, and this year, you can grab some of the biggest PC games of 2025 if luck is on your side. Like previous instances of this event, the Mystery Egg Bundle will offer a randomized selection of PC games from a curated list, ranging from AAA releases to indie gems. A single Mystery Egg is priced at $1, and inside, you'll find a code for a game that can be redeemed on Steam. The more keys you add to your bundle, the lower each costs, maxing out at 25 Steam keys for just $16 total. See bundle at Fanatical If you're really lucky, you might even get a Golden Egg, which contains games worth $1,000 in total and includes titles like Monster Hunter Wilds, Kingdom Come: Deliverance II, Marvel's Spider-Man 2, and Sid Meier's Civilization 7. Fanatical will be offering prizes over the next eight weeks as part of a giveaway, which includes Steam Decks, VR headsets, and discount vouchers. Chosen winners will also unlock Fanatical store spends of up to $100 during this event.One thing to note is that Fanatical will guarantee different games in a single bundle purchase, but there is a chance that you can receive duplicate games if you buy multiple bundles.Continue Reading at GameSpot

author: Cezary Skorupka

title: Abiotic Factor's next update brings in an upgrade system, a chilly new zone, and best of all, functioning bins
description: Right, anybody fancy a new Abiotic Factor update? Well, it's not ready just yet, but developer Deep Field Games did share a look at the game's upcoming Cold Fusion update that looks like it'll be a beefy one. As you can probably guess by the title of the update, there's a bit of a chill coming, specifically in a new area called the Residence Sector. This new locale has "something" going on that's making it a bit too cold for anyone to hang out in, though the mystery behind it is something you'll likely have to play to discover. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Lost Skies' lovely looking sky islands will be launching into early access later this month
description: You know, I've always loved me a sky island in a video game. Can't really tell you why, I just think they're neat! So right from the get go I was pretty easily won over by Lost Skies, another one of those open world survival crafting type games. It's a genre I'm not easily won over by, I don't care for building things all that much, but the pull of the open air is pretty alluring to me. And I won't even have very long to see if I'll bounce off of its craftiness or not, because developer Bossa Studios announced today that Lost Skies is releasing into early access later this month on April 18th. Read more
author: Oisin Kuhnke

title: Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872
description: So…what is the Monday Poll? Excellent question! It isn’t, contrary to its name, an actual poll, like with little clicky buttons. It’s just a list of more or less random questions I’ve been posting on this blog every Monday morning for the past quadrillion years (since 2007). 1. What could you use most right now: cuddles with pets, a hot cup of tea or a nap? I’m drinking a hot cup of tea at the moment, and I’m not too sleepy, so I’ll take the cuddles from the pets. 2. On a scale of 1-10, with 10 being the highest, how concerned are you about AI? Girl. As someone who named her daughter after a great science fiction heroine who rises up to help defeat the robots, I’m going to give this a solid 10. I’m freaked out, man! 3. Something unexpected that happened to you recently? Well, I saw a bobcat out of my window when I was at work last week! (See the pic at the top.) The campus has a lot of[Continue reading...] The post Makeup and Beauty Blog Monday Poll, Vol. 872 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen

title: Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 856
description: Rosie, being scientifically oriented, has an affinity for baking. She appreciates the precision and thinks of it like working in a lab, except one where you’re able to sample the fruits of your labor. We’re all so excited because she opened her new French bakery, La boulangerie de Rosie, in Novato this weekend. I know! Very exciting. Unfortunately for Rosie, Marnie was her baking assistant, but it doesn’t look like that’s going to work out because Marnie has no regard for recipes or measurements…or really, any kind of precision. Actually, Rosie didn’t come up with the idea for the bakery herself. Tabs, as you know, was very forwarding thinking, and toward the last years of his reign he planned to open a high-end cat bakery that also catered to humans (but also cats), and Rosie borrowed the idea. We can safely assume that if Tabs had gotten the business off the ground, it would have been a huge success. Yup, everything that cat touched turned to gold. 💛 Your friendly neighborhood beauty addict, Karen The post Sundays With Tabs the Cat, Makeup and Beauty Blog Mascot, Vol. 856 appeared first on Makeup and Beauty Blog | Makeup Reviews, Swatches and How-To Makeup.
author: Karen
